newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank, GeoCities to set up venture in Japan.
newsitem.headline: Softbank, GeoCities to set up venture in Japan.

text.p: Japanese software firm Softbank Corp and GeoCities Corp said on Monday they had agreed to set up a joint venture in Japan later this month.
GeoCities, a U.S. internet venture set up in November 1994, offers 37 cyber-communities of individuals' web pages grouped by themes.
The Japanese joint venture will be established with starting capital of 200 million yen, with Softbank holding a 60 percent stake and GeoCities 40 percent, the companies said in a statement.
GeoCities posted sales of about $50,000 in the U.S. in 1996. Sales are expected to jump to $5 million this year and to $20 million in 1998, the statement said.
The joint venture will rely on corporate advertisements on its web pages for revenue, it said.
